item.title: Carbon credit management to be strengthened towards NDC implementation
item.description: VGP - Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh signed Directive 13/CT-TTg, dated May 2, 2024 on strengthening carbon credit management to implement the Nationally Determined Contributions (NDC).

item.title: Fresh policies come into effect in May 2024
item.description: VGP - New policies regarding standards for civil servants holding leadership and management positions, management and development of industrial clusters, transportation of dangerous goods, and penalties in fishing sector shall come into effect this May.

item.title: Gov't approves plan to realize national energy master plan for 2021-2030
item.description: VGP - Deputy Prime Minister Tran Hong Ha has signed a decision approving a plan to implement the National Energy Master Plan for the period of 2021 - 2030, with a vision to 2050.

item.title: SBV to resume gold bar auctioning
item.description: VGP - The State Bank of Viet Nam (SBV) has finalized necessary procedures to restart auctioning gold bars to increase market supply after an 11-year hiatus.

item.title: Gov’t doubles effort to ensure no power cut
item.description: VGP - Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh signed a public telegram on drastic measures to ensure power supply in dry season in 2024 and coming years.

item.title: Gov’t chief okeys five uninterrupted days off in upcoming April 30-May 1 holiday
item.description: VGP - Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh has approved the Ministry of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs' proposal for five-day Reunification Day-Labor Day holiday from April 27 to May 1.

item.title: Prime Minister demands central bank fix gold price hikes
item.description: VGP - Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh tasked the State Bank of Viet Nam (SBV) to rashly address the disparity between domestic gold prices and the world's market.

item.title: Prime Minister orders strengthening network safety
item.description: VGP - Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh has urged ministries, agencies and localities to take measures to enhance network security and safety.

item.title: List of dangerous goods announced
item.description: VGP - The Government has issued Decree No. 34/2024/NĐ-CP on dangerous goods and transportation of dangerous goods by land motor vehicles and inland waterways.

item.title: Key energy projects announced
item.description: VGP - Deputy Prime Minister Tran Hong Ha signed Decision 270/QD-TTg, dated April 2, 2024 approving a list of national key energy programs and projects.

item.title: Gov't to borrow around US$28 billion in 2024
item.description: VGP - VGP – The Government has approved a plan to borrow up to VND676,057 billion (over US$28 billion) in 2024.

item.title: Gov't adopts plan to implement National Power Development Plan VIII
item.description: VGP – Deputy Prime Minister Tran Hong Ha has signed a decision approving a plan detailing the implementation of the National Power Development Plan VIII (NPDP VIII).

item.title: Outstanding policies take effect from April
item.description: VGP - A part of revised Land Law, and regulations on English graduation exam exemption and fire prevention are scheduled to take effect from April.

item.title: Gov’t doubles effort to control gold market
item.description: VGP - Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh has requested relevant ministries and agencies to take more measures to manage the gold market.

item.title: Network of public science and technology organizations approved
item.description: VGP - Deputy Prime Minister Tran Luu Quang has signed a decision approving a master plan on the network of public science and technology organizations in Viet Nam in the 2021-2030 period with a vision towards 2050.

item.title: Foreign tourists allowed to bring motorized vehicles to Viet Nam from this May
item.description: VGP - Foreign tourists will be permitted to bring their motorized vehicles participating in road traffic in Viet Nam from May 1, 2024.

item.title: Master plan on environmental monitoring issued
item.description: VGP - Deputy Prime Minister Tran Hong Ha has signed a decision approving the National Environmental Monitoring Planning in the 2021-2030 period with a vision towards 2050.

item.title: Gov't approves Project on multi-use values of forest ecosystem
item.description: VGP - Deputy Prime Minister Tran Luu Quang has signed a decision approving a project on developing multi-use values of the forest ecosystem to 2030, with a vision to 2050.
